UserManual:How can I access the Context Sensitive Help

revision.text:
The '''Context Sensitive Help (CSH)''' is always available except when one uses the ''Modern skin''.
'''1.''' If you are using ''OntoSkin3'', you should see the question mark icon on your browser.
Upon clicking it, a new window opens. This window has the corresponding CSH texts, answers and solutions to the problems.
'''2.''' If you are using any other skin, you will see the name '''''Help''''' instead of the question mark icon.The CSH is in this '''''Help''''' menu.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/02/23 |answer=CSH is a part of the Semantic Toolbar which can only be seen if the OntoSkin Skin is enabled |for_releases=Help:Halo Extension 1.4.3, Help:SMW+ 1.4.3, Help:Halo Extension 1.4.4, Help:Halo Extension 1.4.5, Help:SMW+ 1.4.4, Help:SMW+ 1.4.5 }} [[UME discourse state::DiscourseState:undefined| ]] [[UME link::Help:Context Sensitive Help| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I activate the advanced annotation mode

revision.text:
The '''Advanced Annotation Mode (AAM)''' is triggered by user request. '''1.''' First click the '''More''' tab which is on your page’s upper right section.
'''2.''' Then click on '''Annotate'''. Note that the '''AAM''' is only available in the '''''Ontoskin'''''. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2009/12/11 |answer=To activate the SHE, simply check the |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Description of the Semantic toolbar 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I active the factbox

revision.text:
To enable the Factbox, please follow the following steps:
'''1.''' '''Open '''SMW settings file:
{SMWFOLDER}'''\'''extensions'''\'''SemanticMediaWiki\includes'''\'''SMW_Settings.php
'''2.''' '''Locate''' configuration option.
'''3.''' '''Change''' the Factbox settings to this:
$smwgShowFactbox = SMW_FACTBOX_NONEMPTY; {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/02/04 }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Activating the factbox| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add a rights template

revision.text:
Once you have created an ACL, you will be able to add rights template by following these steps. As a prerequisite, you need to first create at least one template.
'''1.''' '''Click''' on the Add template button.
'''2.''' '''Press''' on the check boxes and '''select''' your desired existing ACL templates.
'''3.''' '''Click''' on the Use selected template button.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/03/30 }} [[UME discourse state::HaloACL| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating a standard ACL| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add a web service call

revision.text:
To add a web service, please follow these steps:
'''1.''' '''Open''' the ''special page''  [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Special:UseWebService Special:Use Web Service] directly or from the Semantic Toolbar, that is if you are editing an article.
'''2.''' '''Place''' the cursor in the editor, to the position where you wish to embed the web service call.
'''3.''' '''Click''' on the ''add web service call'' link in the Semantic Toolbar. You will be redirected to the GUI for embedding a web service call.
Once you have gone through all the five GUI steps, you will again be redirected to the article's edit mode and the web service call will be added to the editor automatically. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::EditWYSIWYG| ]] [[UME link::Help:Embedding web services in articles using GUI| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add an image on a page
UserManual:How can I add interwiki links to other languages

revision.text:
If your system has a Wiki family running on it, you may link an article to its equivalent in another language. For example, let’s apply this on:
 [[de:Hauptseite]]
*In doing this, your English Main_Page will create a link "Deutsch" below the toolbox, which will direct you to the German wiki Main_Page (Hauptseite). It is also shown in the Sidebar's section. *To create a link inside a text, you need to add a colon before the prefix as shown below: [[:de:Hauptseite]]. [[Category:Context sensitive help article]] {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |answer=Use a language prefix to your link, for instance de: for the German equivalent of your English page. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Adding_links_1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add interwiki links to other projects

revision.text:
Several Wikimedia-Projects, in addition to others, support interwiki linking by default. One may therefore use them without having to edit their database.
In some installations this might not be pre-installed. In such cases try using this:
[[metawikipedia:Main_Page]]
If you want to setup interwiki links, you might need to edit the wiki's database or to install an Interwiki extension, please contact your wiki administrator for details about how you may achieve this. [[Category:Context sensitive help article]] {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |answer=Use interwiki prefixes to your links, if enabled in your wiki |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Adding links 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add links to a page

revision.text:
Links in MediaWiki are classified in four types:
'''1.''' Internal Links are links to other wiki pages.
For example if you enter, [[Main Page]] you will get '''Main Page'''.
'''2.''' External Links are links to pages in other websites.
For Example: If you enter an external link with a different label i.e:
[http://mediawiki.org MediaWiki] , you will get :[http://mediawiki.org MediaWiki]
'''3.''' Interwiki Links are links to other websites that are registered to the wiki in advance.
'''4.''' Interlanguage Links are links to other websites registered as other wiki language versions. To add an internal link, enclose the name of the page you want to link to in double square brackets. When you save the page, you'll see the new link pointing to your page. *If the page already exists it will be displayed in blue. *Empty pages are displayed in red.
Selflinks to the current page are not transformed in URLs, they are displayed in bold.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=A simple text or surrounded by wiki markup |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWYSIWYG| ]] [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Adding links 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add modification rights

revision.text:
Modifying the rights serves the purpose of allocating /restricting your ACL’s modification rights. In doing this, you define the user-groups or users who have permission to modify sour ACL.
'''1.''' '''Click''' the ''plus button'' to expand the Modification Rights box.
'''2.''' '''Select''' the user/user group that you wish to grant the rights to modify your ACL.
'''3.''' '''Click''' on the save button. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/03/30 }} [[UME discourse state::HaloACL| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating a standard ACL| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add service links to a wiki

revision.text:
To add a new ''Swoogle service'' to the [http://ontoworld.org/wiki/Property:Namespace Property:Namespace] one should follow the these steps.
'''1.''' '''Edit''' the article [http://ontoworld.org/wiki/Property:Namespace Property:Namespace] and '''adding''' this line:
As an additional service, this property provides a [[provides service::Swoogle lookup]] of the entered namespace.
'''2.''' '''Click''' Save.The fact-box will display a link to the [http://ontoworld.org/wiki/MediaWiki:Smw_service_Swoogle_lookup Swoogle lookup] service, which is at this point still non-existent.
'''3.''' '''Click''' this link. A new edit field opens, that is if you are logged in as an administrator. One should then enter the following line:
Swoogle lookup|[http://swoogle.umbc.edu/index.php?option=com_frontpage&service=digest&queryType=digest_ns&searchString=$1 http://swoogle.umbc.edu/index.php?option=com_frontpage&service=digest&queryType=digest_ns&searchString=$1]
'''4.''' '''Replace''' the search string (at the end of the link) with the parameter '''"$1"'''. '''5.''' '''Save''' the new service. It will henceforth be fully functional. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |answer=Adding a service with the special property |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Adding service links 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I add the 'Upload-file'-link to a form
UserManual:How can I add tooltips to my form
UserManual:How can I annotate a n-ary property

revision.text:
N-ary properties can have multiple values at a time. When the properties name is entered, the system retrieves its arity and goes on to provide the corresponding input fields. They are annotated just like one would edit the custom properties.
'''Writing wiki text:'''
'''1.''' '''Switch''' to edit mode.
'''2.''' '''Write''' [[has propriety:=value0; value1; value2]].
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=N-ary properties are annotated in the same way as normal ones |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME link::Help:Annotating a n-ary property 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I annotate a part in the AAM

revision.text:
Frequently used relations are patrimonies that indicate that something consists of something else.
Example : Every Car has an '''engine'''.
'''1.''' '''Select''' the part e.g. "engine" ,in the article.
'''2.''' '''Click''' ''Has part'' in the "Properties" section.
'''3.''' '''Select''' a ''part'' or a ''basic structural unit'' of the article's subject.
'''4.''' '''Click''' ''Add'' to confirm your annotation.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |answer=Click the |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Accessing the Semantic toolbar via annotation mode 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I annotate a property with the semantic toolbar

revision.text:
If you want to annotate a property, its name has to be specified.Auto-completion supports you at this point.
'''1.''' '''Mark''' the text you want to annotate.
'''2.''' '''Press''' the link ''Annotate'' In the section ''Properties''.
'''3.''' '''Enter''' the name of Property (property field).
The system goes on to provide the corresponding input fields.
'''4.''' '''Enter''' its value or object.
'''5.''' '''Enter''' an alternative representation for the value in the field ''Show''.
'''6.''' '''Press''' ''Add'', and '''Save''' the article. The property should now appear in the fact box.


{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=Select the value you wish to annotate in the wikitext and click annotate in the property container of the semantic toolbar. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Description of the Semantic toolbar 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I annotate a property with wiki text

revision.text:
To do this, you should type in two open the double brackets '''[[''' and type at least one letter.
'''1.''' If you are using the auto-triggering feature: *the auto-completion floater will appear automatically. '''2.''' If you are not using the auto-triggering feature, you should: *'''Press''' Ctrl+Alt+Space. *'''Filter''' the results again by typing additional letters; that is if the desired property is not in the list. *'''Choose''' a property. The whole annotation is to be closed by ''']]'''. This is done automatically whenever auto-completion is used in the target instance. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |answer=Select the value you wish to annotate in the wikitext and click annotate in the property container of the semantic toolbar. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Description of the Semantic toolbar 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I ask for specific properties of an object in the wiki

revision.text:
There are 3 possibilities of doing this. '''1.''' '''Using the wiki-code''' (and typing the query manually)::
Example: car
 '''[[car]]'''
'''2.''' '''Using the Query Interface:'''
*'''Click''' add instance.
*'''Add''' the object that you desire to get the results of.
'''3.''' '''Adding other properties:'''
'''[[car]] [[price:=*]] [[year of construction:=*]] '''



{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |answer=Add the instance to the query (restriction) |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::QueryInterface| ]] [[UME link::Help:Graphical Query Interface| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I ask new questions in the CSH

revision.text:
If you want to add new question in the CSH, you should:
'''1.''' '''Click''' on the question mark icon to obtain the CSH window and then '''press''' ''Feedback''.
'''2.''' '''Click''' ''Your question is not listed in the help?''.
'''3.''' '''Write''' your desired question in the input textbox.
'''4.''' '''Press''' ''Submit feedback'' button.

{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2009/12/23 |answer=You can look at the CSH area in the Semantic Toolbar, or you can also access the Special Page |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Context Sensitive Help| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I attach service links to a property
UserManual:How can I browse the OntologyBrowser with filters
UserManual:How can I categorize a category

revision.text:
The actual categories and other uploaded files such as images may be cate-gorized in the same way as normal pages. It is useful to connect the article-categories with the categories that are already in place so as to establish connections and hierarchies. Once you save the article, follow the category links at the end of the page to see if the category is already created and if not, categorize them until you connect them with an existing category.
For example, ''Category:american Artist'' should be in both the ''Category:artists by nationality'' and the ''Category:american people''.
[[Category:Context sensitive help article]]
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=Categories themselves can be categorized exactly like normal pages |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Advanced Annotation Mode| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I change an annotated category

revision.text:
To delete an annotated category, please follow these steps.
*'''Click''' the delete button to delete the annotation. *'''Click''' the edit button.
*'''Click''' the ''Delete'' link in the following dialog. The annotation should now have been deleted.
To change an annotated category
*'''Click''' the edit button of the category you want to change. *'''Enter''' a new name and '''click''' ''Change''.
*'''Save''' your changes.
The list of categories and the wiki text will be changed accordingly.

{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2008 |answer=Delete it in the article or edit it in the list of categories |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Changing a property annotations 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I change an annotated property

revision.text:
This is how one may change an annotated property either by editing it or deleting it:
1.  You may do this from the '''Properties''' section of the semantic toolbar where there is a list of all the annotated properties with an edit icon .
2.  This is the effect of using the buttons next to the highlighted annotation:
*The '''Edit''' button takes you to the same dialog as in the semantic tool bar
*The '''Delete''' button deletes the annotation.
If you '''delete''' the annotation, it will no longer be in the list of properties and the highlight in the article will also be removed. If you '''change''' it, the values in the list are updated, but the value in the article will remain the same because of the fixed alternative representation. The annotation's highlight in the article will in this case get a black border-line indicating that this annotation was changed but not saved.

{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2008 |answer=Click the edit icon near the property in the article or in the list of properties |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Changing a property annotations 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I change my user preferences

revision.text:
Clicking on the ''Special:Preferences'' -link in the upper right while logged in allows you to change your preferences.
You will be presented with the '''User profile section''', as well as a bar of tabs across the top which let you change other settings. * User profile * Skin * Files * Date and time * Editing * Recent changes * Watchlist * Search * Misc

{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=MediaWiki |year=2008 |url=http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Preferences |title=Help:Preferences |date retrieved=2009/11/04 }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME discourse state::SpecialPages| ]] [[UME link::Help:Customizing SMW+| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I change my wiki skin
UserManual:How can I change the links in the Navigation Box

revision.text:
The syntax of the bullet points is as follows:
<nowiki>**</nowiki> (''pagename in the wiki'') | (''text shown in the sidebar'')
*You can extend the menu by adding items to the bullet list. If you add another element on the first level (with only one asterisk "*"), a new box will be created with the text behind this bullet as heading.
;Example
<nowiki>**</nowiki> Special:ContextSensitiveHelp|help
*Please note that no square brackets are needed in order to create the links.
[[Category:Context sensitive help article]]
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2008 |answer=You can customize the navigation links by editing MediaWiki:Sidebar |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::DiscourseState:undefined| ]] [[UME link::Help:Changing Links in the Navigation Box| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I change the links in the navigation tree

revision.text:
To change the navigation tree: #Open the article '''MediaWiki:NavTree''' #Alter the wikitext there. *You can create a custom tree view from articles and data in your Wiki requires using [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Description_of_the_tree_parser_function the syntax of the #tree-parser function.]
*You can also make use of semantic properties to easily construct very complex trees using [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Description_of_the_generateTree_parser_function the #generateTree-parser function.] [[Category:Context sensitive help article]] {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |answer=You can customize the navigation links by editing the article NavTree |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Authoring and customizing trees| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

revision.text: You can control template inclusion using {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/11/16 |answer=You can control template inclusion by the use of and tags. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::Template| ]] [[UME link::Help:Using templates to simplify annotations| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I control the pages to watch

revision.text:
Only the pages that are '''not dynamically generated''' may be watched.
The page is always watched together with its talk page. All additions to and deletions from the list of watched pages apply to the non-talk page / talk page combination: it's not possible to watch one without watching the other.
Here are the ways of controlling the watched pages:
*'''While viewing a page'''
:
:Clicking the '''''watch''''' link which is located at the margin of each page will add the current page to your watchlist.
*'''While saving a page'''
:
:When saving an edited page, the new watch status (Watching or not watching) is determined by the '''''Watch this page''''' checkbox.
:If one activates the user preference '''''Add pages I edit to my watchlist''''', the checkbox on the edit page will automatically be checked, so the page will be watched upon saving unless if it is unchecked before saving.
Other additional options are:
:#'''''Add''' '''pages I create to my watchlist'''.  ''(You do not have to check it again if the previous one is checked) :#'''''Add pages I move to my watchlist'''.'' :#'''''Add pages I delete to my watchlist'''''.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/11/26 |answer=Only non-dynamically-generated pages can be watched. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::SpecialPages| ]] [[UME link::Help:Watching pages| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create ACLs
UserManual:How can I create Ranges and Types in new property

revision.text:
The default settings set the type to "Type:Page" i.e. the value of the property is another article. For reasoning and gardening purposes, the category of these articles should be specified in the input field '''Range:''' .
'''Range''' hints are generated in the wiki text as shown below:
:<nowiki>[[Has range hint::Category:Product]] </nowiki>
'''Types''' are simple data types like integer numbers or strings.
:*To define a type, the range can be removed with the red cross . :*Going on, the new type is added by clicking the link '''Add type'''. :**All built-in and user defined types can be selected in the selection field.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |answer=Click |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Description of the Semantic toolbar 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create a default ACL user template

revision.text:
To create a default ACL user template you should:
  1. First go to the specialpage '''Special:HaloACL''' using the Administration-menu or using the list of all specialpages.
  2. Then click '''Create ACL default user template''' and
  3. Press the '''Next Step''' button.
Note: You need to be logged-in and have WikiSysop rights. You can only create an ACL default user template for pages. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/03/30 }} [[UME discourse state::HaloACL| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating a standard ACL| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create a form with preloaded data

revision.text:
You have several ways of creating a form with preloaded data:
'''1.1''' Specify a '''''default''''' value for whatever fields you want to have a value for in the form.
'''1.2''' Specify a "preload" page for the "free text" input, which will preload the free text field with the contents of that page.
'''1.3''' Add 'preload=preload-page-name' to the 'query string=' value in the 'forminput' call; this will preload the entire form with the contents of that page.
'''2.1''' Add a "preload=..." value to the query string for a 'FormStart' or 'FormEdit' URL.
'''2.2''' Add "template-name[field-name]=field-value" to the 'query_string' value in the 'forminput' call, to '''set''' the value for a specific field.
'''2.3''' To preload values for more than one field use "'''''&'''''": "template-name[field-name-1]=field-value-1'''&'''template-name[field-name-2]=field-value-2"
'''3''' Add a value for a specific field to the URL query string for '''FormStart''' or '''FormEdit'''.
'''4''' Create your own custom handling, using the 'sfEditFormPreloadText' hook. If another extension calls this hook, it can preload data however it wants. The function registered with this hook should have a header like "function-name(&$page_contents, $page_title, $form_title)".
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/03 }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticForms| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating Links for Adding and Editing Articles with Semantic Forms| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

    3. *Form edit mode = Open the collapsed section '''Describe the category''' and deactivate the checkbox '''Exclude from automatic semantic forms'''. *Edit mode (Wikitext) = Remove the annotation '''No automatic formedit'''.

revision.text:
If you want to create a new property:
  1. First click '''Create''' in the section "Properties" of the semantic toolbar.
  2. Enter the '''name of the property'''
  3. Enter its '''domain'''. :*If you are editing a category, the domain is already set to the current category.
  4. Specify its range or type. :*By default the type is "Type:Page" i. e. the value of the property is another article. :*For reasoning and gardening purposes, the category of these articles should be specified in the input field '''Range'''. :*Types are simple data types like integer numbers or strings. To define a type, the range can be removed with the red cross.
  5. Finally click '''Create'''.
    6. The new property is created and its properties are set in the corresponding new article. __SHOWFACTBOX__ {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=Click |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating a new property 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create a redirect

revision.text:
You must start a new page with the name you want to direct from. Do this by typing the desired name into the search box, or straight into the URL.
Enter the following:
<nowiki>#REDIRECT [[</nowiki>''pagename''<nowiki>]]</nowiki>
where ''pagename'' is the name of the page you want to redirect users to.
You can use the '''preview''' button, to check that you have entered the correct page name.
Generally you will be redirecting to an existing page name, so the link should be blue, not red. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |date retrieved=2009/11/12 |answer=ou must start a new page with the name you want to direct from. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Basic Editing| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create automatic semantic forms

revision.text:
Automatic SFs are always created on-the-fly, based on the most current Wiki ontology. So, if you edit the annotations of a property, e.g. change the value of its "Has type" annotation, this will be immediately reflected in all related automatically created SFs.
For each direct category annotation of the edited article, there will be a collapsible section in the SF. The collapsible section will contain all form input fields, that correspond to properties that have the category or one of its super-categories as their domain. *If a category does not exist or if there are no properties that have the category or one of its super-categories as their domain, and if the corresponding section in the SF therefore would be empty, then the section will not be displayed in the SF. *If one of the direct category annotations of the article is a super-category of one of the other direct category annotations of the article, then no section for that category will be displayed in the SF. *If two or more of the direct super-categories of an article share the same super-category, then the corresponding SF sections would show form input fields for the same properties, which is not very nice. Therefore, if two or more categories, for which a section is displayed in the SF, share the same super-category, an additional section for that super-category is shown in the SF. The additional section then will contain all form input fields, that otherwise would be shown by the sub-categories. *The different sections in the SF are ordered as follows:
  1. Super categories are shown.
  2. Categories on the same level in the category hierarchy are then ordered alphabetically.
  3. The bottom of the form shows the free text input field.
    4. '''Note''':The automatic form creation process for articles only works when no default SF has been defined. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise |year=2011 |date retrieved=2011/03/15 }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating automatic semantic forms| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create hierarchies of categories

revision.text:
'''Prerequisite:''' You are editing an article which defines a category.
'''First case:''' You want to make this category a sub-category of other categories.
# Press '''Annotate''' in the '''Categories''' section of the semantic toolbar. # Enter the name of the super category in the field '''Name'''. If the entered name gets a green background then this indicates that the category already exists whereas orange indicates a non-existent category. # Press the '''Add''' button.
'''Second case:''' You want to make this category a sub-category of another category. If the super-category does not exist, it is created. # Press '''Sub/Super''' in the '''Categories section''' of the semantic toolbar. An input field for the name of the super category appears. # Enter the name of the super category, press '''Enter''' or '''Tab'''. The system checks whether the-category already exists. If it does it will put it in green and if it doesn’t then it is displayed in orange. #Click '''Create ... super category'''... or '''Make ... super category''' .... The current article is annotated as subcategory. If the super category does not exist, it is created and opened in a new browser tab.
'''Third case:''' You want to make this category a super-category of another category. If this sub-category does not exist, The steps to be followed are same as in the second case, only that you in this case you click ''' Make ...sub Category'''...or '''Create ... sub category'''...
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=Use |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating hierarchies of categories 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create hierarchies of properties

revision.text:
In order to create hierarchies of properties you should: # Press the link '''Sub/Super''' in the semantic toolbar. # Write the name of your property in the input field.
*If your property doesn't exist, the input field will have an orange background.
**You must first create your property so that you may make it as super- or sub-property.
*If your added property exists, the input field will have a green background.
**You may now make your property as super- or sub-property. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=You can create the hierarchies in the properties property box of the semantic toolbar |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating hierarchies of properties 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create links for adding and editing articles with semantic forms

revision.text:
There are two ways to let users add data in this manner: 1. Using the '''forminput''' parser function: *Add the tag {{#forminput:form=|size=|default value=|button text=|query string=|autocomplete on category=|autocomplete on namespace=}} to any page will make an input that will let you specify a title for adding or editing.
*By default, this input is included in every form created by the '''CreateForm''' page.
2. Using '''FormStart''':
*Go to '''''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Special:FormStart Special:FormStart]'''.
*Specify a form name in the URL (optional), it will looks like '''''/Special:FormStart/form-name'''''.
If no form name is specified, a dropdown of all available forms in the wiki will appear next to the input for the page name, let you make a choice.(''This approach is however not recommended'')
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticForms| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating Links for Adding and Editing Articles with Semantic Forms| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I create n-ary properties

revision.text:
You may define n-ary properties in the same way as properties.
    To do this:
  1. First click '''Create''' in the section "Properties" of the semantic toolbar.
  2. Enter the '''name of the property'''
  3. Enter its '''domain'''. :*If you are editing a category, the domain is already set to the current category.
  4. Specify its range or type. :*By default the type is '''"Type:Page"''' i. e. the value of the property is another article. For reasoning and gardening purposes, the category of these articles should be specified in the input field '''Range'''. '''Types''' are simple data types like integer numbers or strings. To define a '''type''', the '''range''' can be removed by pressing the '''red X icon''' :*Click '''add rang'''e , '''add type''' to add additional types and ranges with the corresponding links.
  5. Finally click '''Create'''.
    6. N-ary properties are defined by a semi-colon separated list of types. What appears as range in the semantic toolbar will be encoded as Type:Page with an additional range hint. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |answer=Click |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Description of the Semantic toolbar 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

To debug Mediawiki, follow these steps: #'''Create ''' a new PHP-Project, but remember to '''deselect''' the '''''Use default location''''' and '''choose''' your wikipath (e.g. C:\xampp\htdocs\wiki) #'''Start''' the debugging session with the index.php file (e.g. [http://127.0.0.1/wiki/index.php?DBGSESSID=1@localhost:10001 http://127.0.0.1/wiki/index.php?DBGSESSID=1@localhost:10001]). Breakpoints in other php-files used in Mediawiki will be recognized.

page.title: UserManual:How can I define ACLs with parser functions

revision.text:
Below is a list of parser functions and the various effects of using them: * '''<nowiki>{{#access:...}}</nowiki> :'''defines an '''access control entry (ACE)''' in an inline right definition form. * '''<nowiki>{{#propertyaccess:...}}</nowiki> :'''defines the access rights for the values of semantic properties. * '''<nowiki>{{#predefinedRight:...}}</nowiki> :'''establishes the connection, when the inline right definitions of ACLs refers to other sets of rights that are defined in another article. * '''<nowiki>{{#whitelist:...}}</nowiki> :'''It may only appear in the article '''ACL:Whitelist'''. * '''<nowiki>{{#manage rights:...}}</nowiki> :'''defines which user(s) or group(s) can change the ACL. * '''<nowiki>{{#addmember:...}}</nowiki> :'''defines a list of users and ACL groups that belong to the group. A warning is issued if a circle of groups is defined. * '''<nowiki>{{#manage group:...}}</nowiki> :'''defines the user(s) or group(s) that can change the group.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::HaloACL| ]] [[UME link::Help:Parser functions in HaloACL| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

revision.text:
Forms are defined using a set of tags that specify templates and fields within those templates.
Wiki-text, and some HTML, can be freely embedded anywhere outside of the tags. {{Copyright of article |own work=False |copyright holder=Semantic MediaWiki |year=2009 |url=http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Semantic_Forms |title=Extension:Semantic Forms |date retrieved=2009/11/08 |answer=Forms are defined using a set of tags that specify templates and fields within those templates |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticForms| ]] [[UME link::Help:Getting started with Semantic Forms programming| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

Having done this, you will have defined the values that are allowed for the attribute. *If you click on the '''edit button''' which is to the right of the property, you may change the changes the values, e.g. to liquid and then go on to click '''Change'''. * Remember to '''save''' the property definition at the end of it all. ''

page.title: UserManual:How can I define credentials in a new web service
UserManual:How can I define multiple values for the same field

revision.text:
*To do this you need to have the Semantic Forms parser function '''''#arraymap''''' in your template. The generic call for this function is:
{{#arraymap:value|delimiter|var|formula|new_delimiter}}
The function splits the value by the delimiter, then, for each one, applies the same mapping that 'formula' does to 'var', and finally joins all the values again using the new delimiter.
*If you choose to use the '''''CreateTemplate''''' page to create a template you should:
Apply '''''#arraymaptemplate''''' onto the main template field just as you would with #arraymap, using the format:
{{#arraymaptemplate:value|'''template'''|delimiter|new_delimiter}}
'''template''' = Name of the mapping template in question.
For both #arraymap and #arraymaptemplate, the string "\n" in the value of either 'delimiter' or 'new_delimiter' will get converted into a newline.
If you want an actual line break to appear between values, you should have two newlines (i.e, "\n\n") as the delimiter. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/03 }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticForms| ]] [[UME link::Help:Defining Semantic Forms| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

;Example: How to create a super-property for an existing property Presuming that the "property number of children" exists one can for example create a new property "number of descendants as a super-property".

  2. Enter the name of the super-property i.e. number of descendants

page.title: UserManual:How can I define the bottom of the form

revision.text:
The input fields at the bottom of the form can be customized using the '''standard input''' tag.
The layout, inclusion and text of each input can be modified.
Each user input is defined as a standard input tag with its own value.
The eight allowed values are:
* "save" (for the "Save page" button)
* "preview" (for the "Show preview" button)
* "changes" (for the "Show changes" button)
* "summary" (for the "Summary" text field)
* "minor edit" (for the "This is a minor edit" checkbox)
* "watch" (for the "Watch this page" checkbox)
* "cancel" (for the "Cancel" link)
* "run query" (for the "Run query" button in query forms)
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticForms| ]] [[UME link::Help:Defining Semantic Forms| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I define update policy in a new web service

revision.text:
Follow these steps to define the update policy in a new Web Service:
  1. First choose the '''display policy''' for displaying results in an article. e.g. if the display policy is set to a '''''max age of 2 days''''' the results of the web service call will be display the cached web service results for 2 days.
  2. After that period the web service will be called again and the cached results will be replaced with the new ones. Otherwise the web service will be called again and the cached result will be replaced. The '''''display policy once''''' means that the web service result will '''never''' be updated.
  3. '''Choose''' the '''''query policy''''' for semantic queries, this updates the gardening bots in your Wiki.
    4. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::WebService| ]] [[UME link::Help:Defining a web service using GUI| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I delete a page

revision.text:
;If you are using ontoskin :Open the article which you want to delete. Click on the "More"-menu (right to the "Edit"-menu), amongst other page related actions, you find there the "Delete" option. Clicking on it deletes the article.
;Note:
'''Normal users''' do not have the permission, rights or privileges to delete a wiki page. Although you can ask your Wiki administrator to give you the right to delete articles.
'''Sysop users''' have the capability of deleting a page (semi-permanently).
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=MediaWiki |year=2008 |url=http://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Deleting_a_page |title=Help:Deleting a page |date retrieved=2008/04/11 |answer=.. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Deleting a page 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I delete a redirect
UserManual:How can I delete an existing group

revision.text:
To delete an existing group you should:
  1. Go to the specialpage '''Special:HaloACL'''.
  2. Click '''Manage groups''' Tab.
  3. Simply click on the check boxes accordingly and choose the groups that you wish to delete.
  4. Go on to click '''Delete selected''' button thereby deleting the groups.
    5. Note: You need to be logged-in and have '''WikiSysop''' rights for you to do this. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/06 }} [[UME discourse state::HaloACL| ]] [[UME link::Help:Changing an Access Control List (ACL)| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I delete an existing whitelisted page

revision.text: As a prerequisite, you need to be logged-in and have WikiSysop rights then: #Go to the specialpage '''Special:HaloACL'''. #Then click '''Whitelist''' tab. #Following on, click on the the check boxes thereby choosing the whitelisted pages that you wish to delete. #Finally click on the '''Delete selected''' button thereby deleting the previously selected pages. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/06 }} [[UME discourse state::HaloACL| ]] [[UME link::Help:Changing an Access Control List (ACL)| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I describe my edit

revision.text:
While editing a page, a small '''Summary field''' under the main edit-box. It's good practice to fill in the '''Edit Summary''' field, or add to it in the case of section editing, since it helps everyone understand what was changed as one is for example looking at the history page. We therefore recommend that one sets the user (under '''Editing''') to "Prompt me when entering a blank edit summary". # If you are applying substitution, it is especially useful to provide the wikitext line that contains the '''subst:''' in the edit summary since the substitution does not otherwise show up in the page history.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Basic Features| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I disable the TreeView
UserManual:How can I disable the overlay preview of files

revision.text:
When one inserts a pdf file in a page using [[Pdf:Test.pdf]] and one clicks on the pdf file link, the overlay preview is opened.
To stop your pdf file from displaying in the overlay '''1.''' Switch to wikitext mode '''2.''' Insert the parameter nopreview behind the file name, e.g. [[Pdf:Test.pdf|nopreview]]. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/23 }} [[UME discourse state::EditWYSIWYG| ]] [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Using image preview overlay| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I discuss an article

revision.text:
Talk pages can be accessed by clicking the '''Discussion''' tab at the top of the page. Add your comment normally by simply editing the page just like you edit other pages. Please note that certain editing conventions for talk pages are recommended: *Always sign your name after your comments. Use the four tildas ''' ~~~~ ''' wiki syntax (or the toolbar button) *Start a new discussion with a ''' ==level 2 heading== ''' at the bottom of the page (or use the '''+''' tab) *Indent replies with colons ''' (':')''' at the beginning of the line.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/11 |answer=Open the |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::General| ]] [[UME link::Help:Using talk pages| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I display information

revision.text:
You can display information using: *'''Property values'''. *'''Category'''. *'''Format'''. All queries display the main list of result pages in the first column by default. In some cases, it can be useful to move that to another position. This is not relevant for [[Special:Ask|Special:Ask]], but it can be quite useful in inline queries. A special printout statement is available for this purpose: 
?
This single question mark addresses the «unlabelled result column» that shows the main result list. Different labels can be assigned with the equality symbol like before e.g. 
?= Results
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2009/04/12 |answer=A way of structuring the contents of a wiki. You can add a page to categories by adding category tags to that page |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::QueryInterface| ]] [[UME link::Help:Creating a Sample Query with the QI| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I do a simple search

revision.text:
Making a simple search involves you entering your keyword in the '''searchbox'''.
*Pressing '''Go''' will take you automatically to the article, if it exists. *Pressing '''Search''' searches all the pages in the wiki. Note: There are some restrictions to this. We name them below.
If you click the Search button without filling in anything, you will be taken to '''Special:Search''' which gives you extra searching options.
#If you click the '''Search''' button without filling in anything, you will be taken to Spe-cial:Search which gives you extra searching options. #If you clicked '''search''' , or '''go''' and the page you were looking for doesn’t exist, you will be presented with a list of articles that matched your search criteria (or a message that no matches were found).
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |date retrieved=2009/12/11 |answer=Use the Search box that's in the sidebar on the left |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::UnifiedSearch| ]] [[UME link::Help:Using the search box 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I do an advanced search

revision.text:
If you want to make an advanced search you should:
  1. Click on [[Special:Preferences|my preferences]].
  2. Then click '''Search.'''
  3. Choose your '''Search options''''' ''and your'' '''Namespaces'''.''
  4. Finally click '''Save''' to save the changes.
    5. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 |answer=On every page there is a search button with search box |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::UnifiedSearch| ]] [[UME link::Help:Using the search box 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I edit a n-ary property

revision.text:
'''N-ary properties''' can have multiple values at a time.
To edit an n-ary property, its '''Type''' has to be first switched to '''N-ary'''. '''Notes:'''
Most of the input fields will be disabled. Two additional links will appear at the bottom of the Property Properties toolbox: namely: * '''Add type''' and * '''Add range'''. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::Property| ]] [[UME discourse state::SemanticToolbar| ]] [[UME link::Help:Editing a n-ary property| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I edit pages
UserManual:How can I edit the import file
UserManual:How can I edit the whole watchlist

revision.text:
:Two additional links are available on top of [[Special:Watchlist|Special:Watchlist]] page:
:[[Special:Watchlist/edit|Special:Watchlist/edit]] produces a full list of linked watched pages (including the talk pages). Selecting one or several checkboxes and then clicking "{{int:watchlistedit-normal-submit}}" button will remove selected pages from the list.

This allows editing the list directly, copying it to an external editor, or replacing it with one created elsewhere. Duplicates are automatically removed on saving.

page.title: UserManual:How can I embed a page within another page

revision.text:
If you do not provide a namespace, the Template namespace will be used |for_releases=all }} The syntax that is used to embed a page in another is: {{Namespace:Pagename}} * If you do not provide a namespace, the Template namespace will be used. * If you want to do this for the pages in the main namespace, add a colon be-fore the page name. * To include an otherwise [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:How_can_I_embed_a_page_within_another_unembedable_special_page "unembedable" special page], you must edit the '''$mList''' array in the file '''includes/SpecialPage.php'''.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |date retrieved=2009/12/11 |answer=Syntax: {{Namespace:Pagename}} If you do not provide a namespace, the Template namespace will be used |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Basic Editing| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I embed a page within another unembedable special page

revision.text:
If you do not provide a namespace, the Template namespace will be used |for_releases=all }} Each entry has this format: 'Pagename' => array( 'PageType', 'Pagename') The possible values for PageType: are: *SpecialPage  *UnlistedSpecialPage *IncludableSpecialPage.
  1. First find the entry for the page you want to embed and change the PageType to IncludableSpecialPage.
  2. You will now be able to include/embed the special page using the include syntax: {{Special:Pagename}}.
    3. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |title=11 |date retrieved=2009/11/04 |answer=Syntax: {{Namespace:Pagename}} If you do not provide a namespace, the Template namespace will be used |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME discourse state::SpecialPages| ]] [[UME link::Help:Basic Editing| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I embed media files into articles

revision.text:
====Using plain wikitext==== The Rich Media Extension lets the system generate a list of media files that are related to an article.
Simply add the following template to the area where you would like to display this list. Usually this is at the bottom of the page: 
 {{RMList|show=True}}
====Using WYSIWYG editor==== '''1.''' Click '''Insert/Edit template'''' '''2.''' Select '''RMList''' from the list of templates '''3.''' Click '''OK''' {{ShowComments |show=True }} {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/23 }} [[UME discourse state::EditWYSIWYG| ]] [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Embedding rich media into articles| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I embed the upload media files links
UserManual:How can I embed web service call into a page

revision.text:
1. '''Choose web service''': Choose one of the available web services in the dropdown-menu which is at the top of the page.
  2. ''' Define parameters''': The table displays the included parameters of the web service. Required parameters will be activated by default. If you would like to use a parameter when calling the web service, you should activate the '''Use'''-Checkbox and provide a '''value''' for that parameter. Some parameters provide '''default values'''. If you '''like to use a default value''' instead of providing your own value, then go on to activate the '''Use default value'''-checkbox. If this fields are have a grey background this indicates that there are no values available.
  3. ''' Choose result parts''': Activate the '''Use'''-Checkboxes of each result part that you wish to display in your Wiki article.
  4. ''' Choose output format''': Choose the '''format''' you like to use for displaying the web service result in your Wiki article from the dropdown-list. Some formats also require you to specify the '''template''' that will be used for formatting the rows of the result. An overview of all templates at the page can be seen at [[Special:Templates]].
  5. ''' Result''': This last step has three possibilities. :* The '''Display preview'''-button shows a preview of the web service results. :* The '''Display #ws-syntax'''-button displays the #ws-syntax which was created by the GUI. :* The '''Copy to clipboard'''-button copies the #ws-syntax to local clipboard. In case you navigated to this GUI from the semantic toolbar while you were editing an article, you may go back directly and the #ws-syntax will be automatically '''added into the editor'''.
    6. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 }} [[UME discourse state::WebService| ]] [[UME link::Help:Embedding web services in articles using GUI| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I enable the comments feature in an article
UserManual:How can I evaluate annotations

revision.text:
The buttom section of the '''FindWork special page''' has a rating facility. It lets you rate annotations. An annotation is a triple (subject, predicate, object or value). Every time you access this '''FindWork special page''', you get a random list of unrated and already rated triples(annotations). You may rate the attribute and binary relation annotations. Rating of N-aries is not currently supported. There are three possible ways of rating an annotation: *'''Correct''': If you think that the triple is correct- ''This increases the annotation's rating by one'' *'''Wrong''': If you think that the triple is wrong -''This decreases the the annotation's rating by one'' *'''Don't know''':Doing this will consequently ''not make any change''
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/11/04 |answer=Evaluation of annotations helps to find and fix bad annotations |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Annotate| ]] [[UME link::Help:Annotating the essence of an article| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I export articles

revision.text:
Pages may be exported in four ways:
  1. By '''pasting''' the article’s name in the box that is in the [[Special:Export|Special:Export]] page or use this alternative link: {{fullurl:Special:Export/FULLPAGENAME}}.
  2. Using the '''backup script''' [http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/wikipedia/phase3/maintenance/dumpBackup.php dumpBackup.php] which dumps all the wiki pages into an XML file. The dumpBackup.php only works on MediaWiki 1.5 or any other later versions. You also require direct access to the server so that you may run this script. Mediawiki projects dumps are more or less regularly made available for download from: [http://download.wikipedia.org http://download.wikipedia.org]. *'''Note''' that you sometimes might have to configure AdminSettings.php in order to run dumpBackup.php successfully.
  3. Using the '''OAI-PMH-interface''' which regularly fetches the pages that have been modified from a specific time. This interface is not available to the public users in wikimedia projects. OAI-PMH contains a wrapper format around the actual exported articles.
  4. Using the [http://pywikipediabot.sourceforge.net/ Python Wikipedia Robot Framework]. The details about how this is done will not won't be explained here
    5. The default settings will only include the current version of a page. You also have the option of getting all versions with the date, time, user name and edit summary. The latest versions of all templates that are either called directly or indirectly are also exported. Additionally you can copy the SQL database. Versions prior to MediaWiki 1.5 used to create database dumps in this manner. We will therefore not explain this here. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/11/25 |answer=There are at least four ways to export pages |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Export| ]] [[UME discourse state::SpecialPages| ]] [[UME link::Help:Exporting articles| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I filter the search results
UserManual:How can I find close matches

revision.text:
Below is a sample use-case which may be used to find related matches using '''ASK-queries''': [[hasThing:~color]] The number of '''~''' signs in the syntax denotes the number of '''typos''' that are allowed and taken into account. In reference to this example, all attribute values with distance of "1" to colour are considered as correct matching, positive results! That means, '''''colour''''', '''''Color''''', '''''culor''''' and so on would deliver results. The near matches are not only limited to mistyped string attributes but also useful regarding float numbers.
Following on, [[Category:Person]] [[*:=*]] [[wasBorn:~~~2007-05-11]] would result in a list showing all attributes of all persons that were born between 2007-05-08 and 2007-05-14 (3 days deviation due to the 3 '''~''' signs. In reference to integer units, the number of '''~''' signs denotes the factor of a fixed tolerance of 5%. [[hasPopulation:~~100000]] Such a query would match all pages that contain the hasPopulation attribute with a value of at least 90000 or at most 110000 (10% deviation due to the 2 '''~''' signs). ;'''A note for administrators - Installation instructions''' A new function for calculating the edit distance needs to be added to the existing MySQL server. A detailed installation instruction and the necessary file containing the needed method is available in the CVS: extensions/SemanticMediaWiki/libs/INSTALL.TXT {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/11/25 |answer=Use the tilde symbol in front of a property value |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::EditWikisyntax| ]] [[UME link::Help:Hints for handling the search 1.5.3| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I find work

revision.text:
The articles that are suggested to you in the '''Specialpage [[Special:FindWork]]''' are a reflection of your interests based on your edit history.
* If you don't know what to choose, just click on '''Give me some Work''' button.
:The system will then select something for you.
* If you want to work on a more specific issue you can use the drop box to choose one of the options and click '''Go'''.
{{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/11/04 |answer=Go to the Specialpage FindWork, there you can simply press 'Give me some work' to receive a list of pages with random gardening issues (with respect to your edit-history). Alternatively, you can be more specific and choose a class of issues. |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Gardening| ]] [[UME link::Help: How can I find work| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I format text
UserManual:How can I format text (WYSIWYG)

revision.text:
Whenever the input mode is changed to Wiki text in the WYSIWYG-editor, the normal Wiki editor still remains accessible. In some cases the WYSIWYG-editor breaks the original wikitext because it interprets the wikitext wrongly. This mostly happens if templates and parser functions are encapsulated. It follows that the HTML that is generated by the WYSIWYG-editor is broken. The wikitext will also change its content whenever: *whitespaces are used for formating - this especially happens in ''template'' calls. *HTML is used even though there is also method of doing this in wikitext (i.e.
  • ). *some HTML elements get special attributes from the WYSIWYG-editor. These do not affect the output but change the code. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2010 |date retrieved=2010/04/12 }} [[UME discourse state::EditWYSIWYG| ]] [[UME link::Help:Description of the WYSIWYG-Editor| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I format the export file

revision.text:
The format of the XML file you get is always the same. It is coded in XML Schema as seen in: http://www.mediawiki.org/xml/export-0.3.xsd This format is not meant to be viewed in a web browser. Some browsers show you pretty-printed XML with "+" and "-" links which reveal or hide the selected parts respectively. The XML-source may alternatively be viewed using the browser’s "view source" feature or even with a program of your choice once the XML file is saved locally.
As you read the XML source directly, one can easily find the actual wikitext.
If you don't use a special XML editor, "<" and ">" will appear as respectively. Additionally, "&" is coded as "&" This helps avoid any conflict with the XML tags and also to avoid any ambiguity. In the current version, the export format does not contain an XML replacement of wiki markup. This means that you will only get the wikitext similar to the one you get when editing the article. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |answer=There are at least four ways to export pages |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::Export| ]] [[UME discourse state::SpecialPages| ]] [[UME link::Help:Exporting Data with RDF Export Functionality| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I formulate a query

revision.text:
1. Go to the special page '''Special:QueryInterface ''' or if you are using the WYSIWYG editor, click on the Query interface button in the WYSIWYG toolbar -this button has a small question mark and a small arrow and is located on the lower right section of the WYSIWYG editor toolbar.
  2. Proceed to define your query by clicking on the '''Add Category ''' ,'''Add Property''', '''Add Instance''' menu correspondingly and entering the required parameter accordingly.
  3. Go to the Result section and format the way the query results are displayed in the '''Format Query subsection'''
  4. Go to the '''Result''' section below and click on the '''Result Preview''' subsection to preview your query. Click on the '''Show full result''' link to see display the full result
  5. IF you have a Triple store connected you can activate the Include inferred results via triple store, if not deactivate this checkbox since you will otherwise not get any results!
  6. You can further view your Query as tree or Query as source. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/11 |answer=Add and edit restrictions; preview the results |for_releases=all }} [[UME discourse state::QueryInterface| ]] [[UME link::Help:Complete example of query formulation| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}

page.title: UserManual:How can I get a list of all pages
UserManual:How can I get a preview of an article
UserManual:How can I get an overview of the search log
UserManual:How can I get notified about changes in the semantic annotations

revision.text:
You can manage your personal semantic notifications from the special page '''Special:SemanticNotifications''' Notes: * If you access this page as anonymous user, you will be asked to log in first, as semantic notifications are personal properties for a user. * Semantic notifications are sent by e-mail. So please '''specify a valid e-mail address''' on your preferences page. * Before you can use the e-mail address for notifications, you have to confirm it. * Once all the preconditions are met, you will gain access to your semantic notification manager with all notifications you have defined. Now, let's for example observe the list of chemical elements. To do this:
  1. Go to the '''query input box''' and click '''Show Preview'''.
  2. Now '''make specifications''' about how often you wish to receive notifications. The value is specified in days. The administrator has defined a minimum for the user groups. '''Note''' that will get an error message, if you enter a value that is below that limit.
  3. Finally '''enter a name for the notification''' and add it to your personal notifications. The new notification should now be seen the '''My notifications''' list.
    4. {{Copyright of article |own work=True |copyright holder=Ontoprise GmbH |year=2009 |date retrieved=2009/12/10 }} [[UME discourse state::SemanticNotifications| ]] [[UME discourse state::SpecialPages| ]] [[UME link::Help:Register for Semantic Notifications| ]] {{Content hash|value=}} {{Part of bundle|value=Smwusermanual}}
